meta.title: Tulsa Public Schools

meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Tulsa Public Schools, Independent School District No. 1

meta.name: format-detection

body.class: fsLiveMode fsHasHeader fsHasMenu fsHasFooter fsHasOneColumnLayout home fsHasTheme2

div.span: Tulsa Public Schools is on a journey to be the destination for excellence in teaching and learning, and we invite you to join us! We have positions available throughout the district: from our classrooms, to our transportation hubs, to our district office. If you are ready to make a difference for teachers, children, and families, we have a place for you at Tulsa Public Schools!

img.alt: A portrait of a teacher in her classroom

li.a: What does the Tulsa Teacher Corps Program Entail?
What are the requirements to join Tulsa Teacher Corps?
How do I know if Tulsa Teacher Corps is right for me?
What subject areas do Corps Members Teach?
How do I apply to join Tulsa Teacher Corps?

div.span: Welcome to Tulsa Public Schools! This is your one-stop shop for information about enrollment, transportation, student safety and nutrition, grades, calendars, athletics, and more.

img.alt: parents and students nav image

li.a: Student and Family Guide to Success
Special Needs Transportation Guide for Parents
McLain High School For Science and Technology

div.span: At Tulsa Public Schools, our mission is to inspire and prepare every student to love learning, achieve ambitious goals, and make positive contributions to our world. We encourage you to learn more about our strategic plan, Destination Excellence, our leadership team, and the latest district news and events.

img.alt: about us navigation image

li.a: Request to Speak to an Item on a Regular Meeting Agenda
Tulsa Way for Teaching and Learning
Explore the Tulsa Way for Teaching and Learning

div.span: We love to hear from the communities we serve, so we hope you will get in touch with any questions, concerns, or suggestions for how we can continue to improve the ways that we support you! We also invite you to learn more about the district office teams that support our schools, teachers, school leaders, and families.

img.alt: Parent and child sitting together.

input.name: q
input.title: search
input.style: width: 100%; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: -0.0625em 0px 0px; height: 1.25em; outline: none;

li.a: Tulsa MET High & Jr. High School

div.class: fsElement fsResourceElement fsSlideshow resources-custom-slider decorative-video fsSlideshowHorizontal fsStatePlaying

img.alt: Tulsa Public Schools Logo
Photo of student working on laptop

figcaption.p: Information and resources for students and families, as well as online learning schedules for all grade levels are available on our Distance Learning page.

img.alt: A chrome book with headphones

figcaption.p: If you are having technology issues with a district device, please contact studentVL@tulsaschools.org or call 539-777-1077.
We take student and staff health and safety seriously. We are monitoring the coronavirus situation and taking precautionary measures to keep our schools safe.

img.alt: bananas, oranges and apples in the cafeteria

figcaption.p: While schools remain closed as a preventive measure against the spread of COVID-19, we will provide all children ages 18 and under with nutritious meals free of charge.

p.a: Click here for locations and times

figcaption.p: We know seniors and their families have questions about what the remainder of the year will look like in light of COVID-19. While learning continues, we are working to address all of these concerns and ensure that seniors stay on track to graduate.

img.alt: A students and teacher working together.

figcaption.p: We are making it easier for families to choose - and stay with - Tulsa Public Schools! Our improved enrollment system ensures that families have an easy and simple process to access the schools that are the best fit for their children.

section.class: fsElement fsPostElement fsList whats-happening fsThumbnailOriginal fsThumbnailFull fsItemCount_4

img.alt: Tulsa Public Schools announces a new process for making vacant buildings available for potential lease

div.a: Tulsa Public Schools announces a new process for making vacant buildings available for potential lease

article.a: Read this news post about Tulsa Public Schools announces a new process for making vacant buildings available for potential lease

img.alt: Class of 2020 Update: April 22, 2020

article.a: Read this news post about Class of 2020 Update: April 22, 2020

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-23 fsTag-12 fsTag-22 fsTag-23 fsTag-27

img.alt: Distance Learning Update: April 16, 2020

article.a: Read this news post about Distance Learning Update: April 16, 2020

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-23 fsTag-12 fsTag-22 fsTag-23 fsTag-27

img.alt: Wellness Support Services for Parents, Students, and Families

div.a: Wellness Support Services for Parents, Students, and Families

article.a: Read this news post about Wellness Support Services for Parents, Students, and Families

img.alt: Students in a line by lockers.

figcaption.p: We look forward to working alongside our team and community to shape the future of Tulsa Public Schools as a place where families and educators choose to stay because the experience is unmatched in excellence.

img.alt: Teacher working on board.

figcaption.p: Tulsa Public Schools teachers are the heart and soul of our work to prepare every student for the greatest success in college, careers, and life. Whether you're a certified teacher or looking to transition into teaching, we're eager for you to join our team of committed educators.

img.alt: Teacher points to a board in a classroom.

figcaption.p: Tulsa Teacher Corps prepares aspiring teachers for the opportunity to join an extraordinary team of educators who work with our community and families to ignite the joy of learning and prepare every student for the greatest success in college, careers, and life.

div.p: Our diversity is a community treasure, and we must foster an inclusive environment by examining biases and resolving unfair practices. Valuing equity means that we must provide resources and supports matched to student need, for every student in every school.

We are honest, trustworthy and have high standards of behavior. We make decisions, take action and approach our work based on what is best for our students and their success. We do the right thing even when it is hard.

img.alt: kindergarten boy wearing awesome batman jacket

div.p: Tulsa needs and expects world-class public schools. Achieving excellence means striving for it every moment of every day. It means sweating the small stuff while we focus on the big picture with determination and persistence.

img.alt: girl creating tower with plastic blocks

div.p: We care for one another, support the personal and professional development of one another, and work together to improve our community. Together we celebrate success, learn from struggles and invest in the development of our teams and team members.

img.alt: basketball champions

div.p: We foster exuberant classrooms, schools and places of work where children and adults pursue their passions and are relentlessly curious. Play is invaluable for students and adults alike. Joy at school and at work makes us more productive, because when we create, innovate and imagine, our motivation grows.

img.alt: teacher hands out art supplies to student

article.div: "The teachers, I could tell they wanted me to succeed. They really showed that they cared and wanted me to have a better future."

img.alt: Caleb Crawford graduated from Tulsa Learning Academy in 2019.
img.data-resource-title: %22The teachers, I could tell they wanted me to succeed. They really showed that they cared and wanted me to have a better future.%22

article.div: "Out of 49 years of my life, all but 11 years I've spent with TPS; either going to school or working at school. I work with great people."

img.alt: Donna Garner is the 2019 Tulsa Public Schools Support Employee of the Year.
img.data-resource-title: %22Out of 49 years of my life, all but 11 years I've spent with TPS; either going to school or working at school. I work with great people.%22

figcaption.p: 2019 Tulsa Public Schools Support Employee of the year.

article.div: "It's family, and we wanted to be more a part of a family than we do an institution."

img.alt: David Harris is a parent of a Tulsa Public Schools student.
img.data-resource-title: %22It's family, and we wanted to be more a part of a family than we do an institution.%22

article.div: “It’s what I’ve been wanting to do since I was in third grade. I chased my own dream and I couldn’t see myself doing anything else. I feel like I’m at home here.”

img.alt: Lewis & Clark teacher Allison Miller.
img.data-resource-title: “It’s what I’ve been wanting to do since I was in third grade. I chased my own dream and I couldn’t see myself doing anything else. I feel like I’m at home here.”

figcaption.p: Teacher, Lewis and Clark Elementary School

article.div: “Every teacher here cares and wants to see every child succeed. Every grade counts and every day counts, and we want them to be here every day.”

img.alt: Mark Twain teacher Shelley Humphrey
img.data-resource-title: “Every teacher here cares and wants to see every child succeed. Every grade counts and every day counts, and we want them to be here every day.”

div.div: District Office: Education Service Center 3027 S. New Haven Ave. Tulsa, OK 74114

img.alt: Tulsa Public Schools Logo
